Description: Mould-made pottery plastic lamp in the form of a head of Silenos, with a filling-hole pierced through the crown of the head. The wick-hole is at the end of the long flat-topped, slightly splayed, blunt-tipped nozzle. The ring handle is mostly broken away. The elongated oval base-ring is flat within. The upper part is covered in a red-brown slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q578)
